question_text: Humans are naturally compassionate and honest. In a study using strategically  placed wallets that appear â€œlostâ€, it was found that wallets with money are more  likely to be returned than wallets without money. Similarly, wallets that had a key  and money are more likely to be returned than wallets with the same amount of  money alone. This suggests that the primary reason for this behavior is  compassion and empathy.   Which one of the following is the CORRECT logical inference based on the  information in the above passage?
option1: Wallets with a key are more likely to be returned because people do not care  about money
option2: Wallets with a key are more likely to be returned because people relate to  suffering of others
option3: Wallets used in experiments are more likely to be returned than wallets that are  really lost
option4: Money is always more important than keys             GATE 2022 Petroleum Engineering (PE)  Page 6 of 42

question_text: The information contained in DNA is used to synthesize proteins that are necessary  for the functioning of life. DNA is composed of four nucleotides: Adenine
option2: , and Guanine (G). The information contained in DNA  can then be thought of as a sequence of these four nucleotides: A, T, C, and G. DNA  has coding and non-coding regions. Coding regionsâ€”where the sequence of these  nucleotides are read in groups of three to produce individual amino   acidsâ€”constitute only about 2% of human DNA. For example, the triplet of  nucleotides CCG codes for the amino acid glycine, while the triplet GGA codes for  the amino acid proline. Multiple amino acids are then assembled to form a protein. (ii)  The function of about 98% of human DNA is not understood.

question_text: Consider the following accident scenario:  Failure of a drain connection on a rich oil line at the base of an absorber tower in  a gas producing plant allowed the release of rich oil and gas. The resulting vapor  cloud ignited from the ignition system of an engine-driven recompressor. The  absorber tower eventually collapsed across a pipe rack. The breakage of the  pipelines added more fuel to the fire and lead to the total destruction of the plant.  The resulting fire burnt for 3 days.  Match the three steps of any accident (initiation, propagation, and termination) to  the events that occurred in the above scenario.  Steps of Accident  Events  (P) Initiation    (I) Formation of vapor cloud   (Q) Propagation  (II) Failure of drain connection  (R) Termination    (III) Consumption of all combustibles
option4: P-I; Q-II; R-III

question_text: Which of the following definition(s) related to fire and explosion is/are CORRECT?
option1: Fire point is the lowest temperature at which the vapour above a liquid will continue  to burn once ignited.
option2: Deflagration is the explosion in which the reaction front moves at a speed greater  than the speed of sound in the unreacted medium.
option3: Detonation is the explosion in which the reaction front moves at a speed less than  the speed of sound in the unreacted medium.
option4: Flash point of a liquid is the lowest temperature at which it gives enough vapour to  form an ignitable mixture with air.

question_text: In a capillary rise experiment with a capillary tube of length l1, water rises to a height  h such that h < l1.   If the capillary tube is cut to a length l2 such that l2 < h, and the experiment is  repeated, which of the following statements is/are CORRECT?

option2: Water does not overflow from the top of the tube.
option3: At equilibrium, radius of curvature of meniscus are same in both the experiments.
option4: At equilibrium, radius of curvature of meniscus are different in both the  experiments.
